content:
Based on the execution logs and entity data, here's the updated report:

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Plate Production Facility
Consists of three stone furnaces in a row:
- Furnace 1 at position (0.0, 0.0)
- Furnace 2 at position (2.0, 0.0)
- Furnace 3 at position (4.0, 4.0)
All furnaces are working and processing copper ore into copper plates

### Storage System
Series of wooden chests storing various materials:
- Chest at (6.5, 11.5) storing iron plates (1161)
- Chest at (12.5, 11.5) storing mixed materials (iron plates, copper plates, electronic circuits)
- Chest at (14.5, 11.5) storing iron plates (full - 1600)
- Chest at (16.5, 11.5) storing copper plates (850)

### Copper Cable Assembly Line
Located around position (9.5, 11.5), consists of:
- Assembling machine for producing copper cables
- Two burner inserters at (7.5, 11.5) and (11.5, 11.5) for input/output
- Connected to storage chests on both sides

### Power Generation System
Located around y-position 24.5, consists of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5)
- Boiler at (-7.0, 24.5)
- Steam engine at (-2.5, 24.5)
- Connected pipe network for water and steam transport
- Electric pole network connecting various structures

### Science Pack System
Located at the southern part of the facility:
- Lab with automation and logistic science pack inputs
- Burner inserter at (0.5, 30.5)
- Storage chest at (0.5, 31.5) containing science packs

ERROR TIPS

### Power Supply Issues
- Ensure boiler has constant fuel supply - multiple instances of boiler running out of fuel
- Steam engine showing "not connected to power network" - verify electrical connections

### Assembly Machine Issues
- Assembly machine showing "not receiving electricity" - check power pole connections
- Unable to extract copper cable from assembly machine - ensure required resources (copper plates) are available and machine is powered

### Resource Management
- Monitor coal levels closely - multiple instances of attempting to insert coal when inventory is empty
- Keep track of furnace fuel levels to maintain continuous operation

### Storage Management
- One storage chest is completely full (iron plates) - consider adding more storage or better distribution
- Monitor chest contents to prevent overflow situations
